verses.kjv: And in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplied, there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.
verses.ct: During this time, as the number of believers was growing rapidly, the Greek-speaking Jews began complaining against the Hebrew-speaking Jews because their widows were being overlooked in the daily distribution of food.

verses.kjv: Then the twelve called the multitude of the disciples unto them, and said, It is not reason that we should leave the word of God, and serve tables.
verses.ct: So the 12 apostles gathered all the disciples together and said, "It wouldn't be right for us to neglect the message of God in order to manage food distribution."

verses.kjv: Wherefore, brethren, look ye out among you seven men of honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.
verses.ct: "So, brothers, choose 7 men from among you who are well respected, filled with the Holy Spirit and wisdom, and we will put them in charge of this responsibility."

verses.kjv: But we will give ourselves continually to prayer, and to the ministry of the word.
verses.ct: "That way, we can devote ourselves fully to prayer and to teaching the message."

verses.kjv: And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch:
verses.ct: Everyone was pleased with this proposal. They selected Stephen, a man filled with faith and the Holy Spirit, along with Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolas, a convert to Judaism from Antioch.

verses.kjv: Whom they set before the apostles: and when they had prayed, they laid their hands on them.
verses.ct: They brought these men before the apostles, who prayed and placed their hands on them.

verses.kjv: And the word of God increased; and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem greatly; and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.
verses.ct: God's message continued to spread, and the number of disciples in Jerusalem grew dramatically. Even a large group of priests came to embrace the faith.

verses.kjv: And Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.
verses.ct: Stephen, filled with faith and power, performed remarkable signs and miracles among the people.

verses.kjv: Then there arose certain of the synagogue, which is called the synagogue of the Libertines, and Cyrenians, and Alexandrians, and of them of Cilicia and of Asia, disputing with Stephen.
verses.ct: But some members of what was called the Synagogue of the Freedmen — including Jews from Cyrene, Alexandria, Cilicia, and the province of Asia — stood up and began arguing with Stephen.

verses.kjv: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake.
verses.ct: Yet they couldn't hold their own against the wisdom and the Spirit with which he spoke.

verses.kjv: Then they suborned men, which said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses, and against God.
verses.ct: So they secretly persuaded some men to claim, "We've heard him say disrespectful things against Moses and against God."

verses.kjv: And they stirred up the people, and the elders, and the scribes, and came upon him, and caught him, and brought him to the council,
verses.ct: This stirred up the general population, the elders, and the legal experts. They seized Stephen and dragged him before the council.

verses.kjv: And set up false witnesses, which said, This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place, and the law:
verses.ct: They brought in false witnesses who testified, "This man never stops speaking against this holy temple and against the law."

verses.kjv: For we have heard him say, that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place, and shall change the customs which Moses delivered us.
verses.ct: "We've heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will tear down this place and change the traditions that Moses handed down to us."

verses.kjv: And all that sat in the council, looking stedfastly on him, saw his face as it had been the face of an angel.
verses.ct: Everyone sitting in the council stared intently at Stephen, and they saw that his face looked like the face of an angel.
